glsa.title: spamdyke: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in spamdyke might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: spamdyke is a drop-in connection-time spam filter for qmail.

description.p: Boundary errors related to the "snprintf()" and "vsnprintf()" functions in spamdyke could cause a buffer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All spamdyke users should upgrade to the latest version:
